section.name: Feature List
section.p: The following listing shows most, if not all, of Karma's features. For clarity, they've been structured in a number of categories.

subsection.name: Build Management
subsection.p: Build management features describe Karma's support for builds.

ul.li: Source code compilation with javac and jikes.
Modules determine their dependencies and compile them when necessary.

subsection.name: Structural Features
subsection.p: Karma helps in structuring source code, modularization and componentization.

ul.li: Four main types of modules, each with a standardized directory structure.
Working contexts allow for and organized structure of software projects, one for each client ... or project. The amount of working contexts is unlimited.

subsection.name: User Interface Features
subsection.p: No graphical user interface, but the command-line and the console will do for now.

ul.li: Help system; each command is well-documented.
Commands can have any number of aliasses; users can implement their own favourites.
Clearly documented Java API allowing extensions to
Easy to create plugins to extend Karma with commands
